candidates.title: Mark blinds as no-default-features
candidates.body:
This way gamepad support via gilrs doesn't get included unless
Quicksilver's gamepad features is actually enabled.

## Checks
<!--- Go over all the following points, and put an `x` in all the boxes that apply. -->

candidates.title: Restrict image formats to png and jpeg
candidates.body:
Also update image to 0.22 from 0.21, and remove the jpeg rayon feature.
This may take some perf hit on desktop, but it removes unnecessary
complexity and makes jpeg work on web.

Now that image isn't depended on by winit, there's no other crate
toggling on default features accidentally. Removing the rayon feature
actually removes it!

<!--- Describe your changes in detail -->

## Motivation and Context
<!--- Why is this change required? What problem does it solve? -->
<!--- If it fixes an open issue, please link to the issue here. -->
See discussion of image formats in #552 
Resolves #508

## Checks
<!--- Go over all the following points, and put an `x` in all the boxes that apply. -->
<!--- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask. We're here to help! -->
- [x] I have updated `CHANGES.md`, with [BREAKING] next to all breaking changes
- [x] I have updated the documentation if necessary

milestone.title: Async API
milestone.description: Quicksilver's lifecycle will benefit from async / await by removing the need for 'asset' and much of the State as it currently exists.

candidates.body:
<!--- Describe your changes in detail -->
This change brings the [new lifecycle](https://ryanisaacg.com/posts/quicksilver-chanukah-2019-day-6/) and the [basis of the new graphics API](https://ryanisaacg.com/posts/quicksilver-chanukah-2019-day-7/) to release.

## Types of changes
<!--- What types of changes does your code introduce? Remove all those that do not apply -->
- Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)

chosen_pr.title: Restrict image formats to png and jpeg
chosen_pr.body:
Also update image to 0.22 from 0.21, and remove the jpeg rayon feature.
This may take some perf hit on desktop, but it removes unnecessary
complexity and makes jpeg work on web.

Now that image isn't depended on by winit, there's no other crate
toggling on default features accidentally. Removing the rayon feature
actually removes it!

<!--- Describe your changes in detail -->

## Motivation and Context
<!--- Why is this change required? What problem does it solve? -->
<!--- If it fixes an open issue, please link to the issue here. -->
See discussion of image formats in #552 
Resolves #508

## Checks
<!--- Go over all the following points, and put an `x` in all the boxes that apply. -->
<!--- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask. We're here to help! -->
- [x] I have updated `CHANGES.md`, with [BREAKING] next to all breaking changes
- [x] I have updated the documentation if necessary

chosen_detail.title: Restrict image formats to png and jpeg
chosen_detail.body:
Also update image to 0.22 from 0.21, and remove the jpeg rayon feature.
This may take some perf hit on desktop, but it removes unnecessary
complexity and makes jpeg work on web.

Now that image isn't depended on by winit, there's no other crate
toggling on default features accidentally. Removing the rayon feature
actually removes it!
